post.title: A brief guide through Vienna’s record stores
post.content:
As a city known for its baroque and neoclassical architecture, it is pretty clear that Vienna has a classical appeal. Having its rich classical music background in mind, it could reasonably be expected that its main cultural offer would be geared towards the more or less aristocratic tastes. In this sense, we would think that the city has little to give us in terms of alternative culture and independent music. Yet, even though it might lack the contemporary hipness of other European capitals, this would surely be an understatement.

Before visiting the city, the only record store that I was aware of was Teuchtler Schallplattenhandlung u. Antiquariat, an old Viennese institution featured in the film Before sunrise. What I was not aware of, was that the city indeed has a decent number of jams that I would gladly revisit when hopefully coming to town once again. In this article, I present some of the most exciting Viennese record shops.

A quick tip: getting on the tram number 49 on Karl Renner station on the Ring will take you to Westbahnstrasse. Here you’ll find three record shops and you’ll be able to easily reach a number of others nearby.

Substance

Westbahnstrasse 16

If I had the time to visit only one record store in Vienna, Substance would be it. The store has a diverse catalog along with a well-maintained website. There you’ll find more recent releases of mostly independent labels. Definitely a favorite record store in Vienna.

Schallter

Westbahnstraße 13

When leaving Substance, turn to the right and cross Westbahstrasse. There you’ll find Schallter. It’s a record store that has a more eclectic offer when compared to Substance. Besides records, the store offers a wide array of HI-FI equipment. Although, if you are not living here, the chances are slim that you would buy a bulky amplifier.

Das Market

Zieglergasse 40

Das Market is yet another record shop almost on the same street. It is located on the intersection between Westbahnstraße and Zieglergasse. Unfortunately, the onset of the Covid-19 epidemic prevented us from visiting this place in its opening hours, although the store’s window looked quite interesting.

Galea records

Kaiserstraße 67

Further down the Westbahnstraße take a turn right on Kaiserstraße and you’ll find another record store in the same neighborhood. It is owned by an over-friendly and very chatty Slovenian who won’t leave you browse through the collection without telling a story or two. Once again, a more eclectic offer, including a large number of Yugoslav rock music as well as more recent music from the ex-Yu region.

Recordbag Music & Fashion

Kollergerngasse 4

Recordbag Music & Fashion is record shop near the pedestrian street Mariahilfer Str. It’s well stocked with mainly guitar music in a more classic sense. You could easily spend an hour or more here digging through the records on offer.

Rave up

Hofmühlgasse 1

Rave up is yet another small store in which you’ll find independent releases though older major releases are also on the shelves. It is a little bit further away, but still reachable on foot on a downhill path from Mariahilfer Str.

Totem Records

Zollergasse 18-20

Even if you are not able to find something in this mostly metal oriented record store (perhaps, some dark ambient?), it is worth the visit and experience its hidden-in-plain-sight occult interior.

Audiocenter

Judenpl. 9

If you happen to stroll through the center of Vienna, you might bump into Audiocenter on Judenplatz. Although a more conventional and mostly jazz oriented music store, it is quite viable to find records of other genres of music here. Among other releases, we bought Dead can Dance’s  Within the realm of a dying Sun. Definitely worth a visit.

Still, if all fails and you’re out of luck with the stores listed here, one final place that I would suggest is the Saturn located on Mariahilfer Str. Surprisingly, there is a wide array of records and the prices are quite decent. Of course, there are other stores as well, but these are our favorite ones.
